books.name: The Great Gatsby
books.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
books.description: The story of the fabulously wealthy Jay Gatsby and his love for the beautiful Daisy Buchanan.

books.name: To Kill a Mockingbird
books.author: Harper Lee
books.description: The unforgettable novel of a childhood in a sleepy Southern town and the crisis of conscience that rocked it.

books.name: Pride and Prejudice
books.author: Jane Austen
books.description: The novel follows the emotional development of the protagonist, Elizabeth Bennet, who learns the error of making hasty judgments and comes to appreciate the difference between the superficial and the essential.

books.author: George Orwell
books.description: A dystopian novel that explores the consequences of totalitarianism, mass surveillance, and thought control.

books.name: The Catcher in the Rye
books.author: J.D. Salinger
books.description: The story of Holden Caulfield's experiences in New York City following his expulsion from an elite prep school.

books.name: Moby-Dick
books.author: Herman Melville
books.description: The novel tells the story of the obsessive quest of Ahab, captain of the whaling ship Pequod, for revenge against a giant white sperm whale.

books.name: The Lord of the Rings
books.author: J.R.R. Tolkien
books.description: An epic high-fantasy novel that follows the quest to destroy the One Ring and defeat the Dark Lord Sauron.

books.name: The Hobbit
books.author: J.R.R. Tolkien
books.description: The prelude to 'The Lord of the Rings,' following the adventures of Bilbo Baggins as he helps a group of dwarves reclaim their homeland from the dragon Smaug.

books.name: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
books.author: J.K. Rowling
books.description: The first book in the 'Harry Potter' series, which introduces the young wizard Harry Potter and his journey into the world of magic.

books.name: The Hunger Games
books.author: Suzanne Collins
books.description: In a dystopian future, Katniss Everdeen volunteers to participate in the Hunger Games, a televised event in which tributes must fight to the death.

books.name: The Alchemist
books.author: Paulo Coelho
books.description: A philosophical book about following your dreams and listening to your heart's desires on a journey to find one's purpose.

books.name: Brave New World
books.author: Aldous Huxley
books.description: A dystopian novel that explores a society where technological and genetic advancements have led to extreme conformity and social control.

books.name: The Road
books.author: Cormac McCarthy
books.description: A post-apocalyptic novel following a father and son's harrowing journey through a bleak and desolate landscape.

books.name: The Da Vinci Code
books.author: Dan Brown
books.description: A thriller that combines art, history, and religion as Robert Langdon investigates a murder that leads to a global conspiracy.

books.name: The Shining
books.author: Stephen King
books.description: A psychological horror novel that follows a family's terrifying experiences while isolated in a haunted hotel.

books.name: The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy
books.author: Douglas Adams
books.description: A comedic science fiction series that follows the misadventures of Arthur Dent after Earth's destruction.

books.name: The Handmaid's Tale
books.author: Margaret Atwood
books.description: A dystopian novel set in a theocratic society where women's rights have been severely restricted.

books.name: The Catcher in the Rye
books.author: J.D. Salinger
books.description: The story of Holden Caulfield's experiences in New York City following his expulsion from an elite prep school.

books.name: War and Peace
books.author: Leo Tolstoy
books.description: An epic novel that follows the lives of several Russian aristocratic families during the Napoleonic era.

books.name: The Aleph and Other Stories
books.author: Jorge Luis Borges
books.description: The Aleph and Other Stories (Spanish: El Aleph, 1949) is a book of short stories by Argentine writer Jorge Luis Borges. The title work, 'The Aleph', describes a point in space that contains all other spaces at once. The work also presents the idea of infinite time.

coffee.name: Espresso
coffee.description: A strong and concentrated coffee made by forcing hot water through finely-ground coffee beans.

coffee.name: Cappuccino
coffee.description: An Italian coffee drink that is traditionally prepared with equal parts espresso, steamed milk, and milk foam.

coffee.name: Latte
coffee.description: A coffee drink made with espresso and steamed milk. It has a mild flavor and is often topped with a small amount of milk foam.

coffee.name: Americano
coffee.description: A diluted espresso with added hot water, resulting in a coffee similar in strength but different in flavor to drip coffee.

coffee.name: French Press
coffee.description: A method of manually brewing coffee that involves steeping coarsely-ground coffee beans in hot water before pressing them with a plunger.
